4 students killed are honored in BU ceremonies

Boston University graduated more than 6,700 students Sunday in a ceremony that paused in silence to remember four students killed this spring. (Boston Globe)

Wind turbine noise is targeted in Mass.

Environmental officials are considering new regulations that would require the state to review potential noise issues before wind turbines are built in Mass. (Globe)

Legal loophole benefits drunk drivers

State officials are seeking to alter a law allowing some drivers who are prosecuted for drunken driving to avoid some sanctions the law was written to impose. (Globe)

Full cellphone service set for T subway

All underground areas of MBTA's subway system should be fully wired for cellphone use by year's end, said the company designing and installing the network. (Globe)

Two in hospital after Dorchester shooting

Two people were shot on Msgr. Patrick J. Lydon Way in Dorchester on Sunday night and were taken to Boston Medical Center with non-life threatening injuries. (Globe)
